subject: Sexual Health
title: Addiction and Sexual Behavior
description: A short lesson to help you apply Addiction and Sexual Behavior.

hook.text: The brain's reward system can become hijacked by compulsive sexual behavior, resembling addiction patterns.

buildup.text: Repeated high-dopamine sexual stimuli can desensitize the reward system, requiring more to feel the same effect.

discovery.text: Excessive pornography use has been shown to alter brain structure in the striatum, reducing reward sensitivity.

twist.text: Whether compulsive sexual behavior is a true addiction remains debated. The WHO classifies it as an impulse disorder.

climax.text: Regardless of classification, the brain changes are real and treatable with therapy and behavioral interventions.

punchline.text: The reward system can be hijacked. It can also be restored.

quiz.question: How does the WHO classify compulsive sexual behavior?
